issues.title: Add Explainability functionality to the Operator Audit Module (Section 3.3)
issues.author: shaileshprabhu95
issues.body:
While the Operator Audit Module lets the Human Operator get an oversight of the LLM Decision with a corresponding Confidence Score, it is also important to include the Explainability (with counterfactual reasoning) aspect along with the Confidence Score.

I propose the following 3 key aspects of the Explainability functionality.

1. **Decision Breakdown**: Each LLM-generated configuration should include a breakdown of key influencing factors. For example, the LLM Decision may also contain "This configuration was suggested due to high network congestion detected in Telemetry Data".

2. **Justification Logs**: Extend audit records to include decision rationales alongside confidence scores. For example:
    - **Decision**: Increase bandwidth allocation
    - **Confidence Score**: 85%
    - **Key Factors**: High latency in telemetry, SLA violation threshold crossed

3. **Counterfactual Analysis**: The system should simulate “What if?” scenarios
For example, "If no changes are made, network congestion will increase by 15% in the next 5 minutes".

Please review and let me know if I can raise a PR to extend the current Operator Audit Module by adding the above-mentioned Explainability functionality. Thanks!
